topic.title: Creating an Options Page for a Plugin

keywords.indexterm: Creating an options page for a plugin

body.p: Every plugin can contribute an options page that can be accessed from the Administration Page. These options will be persistent in the global options file and can be accessed programmatically either from server-side or client-side code.

section.title: Implementing an Options Page
section.p: First off, you have to add a Java class to your plugin that will be responsible for the options page. The class should extend ro.sync.ecss.extensions.api.webapp.plugin.PluginConfigExtension. An example of such class can be found in the following WebDAV plugin located on GitHub: WebdavPluginConfigExtension.java.
